issue.title: Remove LoggedEventFooter
issue.body:
**Describe the refactoring action**
The LoggedEventFooter was one of our first experiments with WebSocket. We now have some production-level WebSocket uses. It is still written in Vue which we want to remove. We may come back to this again at a later time but then probably using Svelte.

**Expected benefit**
Last Vue component gone.

commits.message:
#3623 - Migrate the recommender event notifier from vue to svelte

- Migrate the JS code from vue to svelte
- Add access control layer to the websocket endpoint for recommender events including unit test
- Make recommender notifications less frequent and more convenient for the end user
- Exclude recommender notification events from the event log (and a few other low-utility events)
- Rebuild package-lock.json
- Try improving destruction of svelte components when they are redrawn by wicket
- Self-destroy recommender notification svelte and annottion sidebar svelte component if they get a message and discover they are no longer visible anyway - this should avoid redundant subscriptions on the server side and the server sending too much data

issue.title: Resolve split packages
issue.body:
Currently, all type system modules use the same package name. This creates problems in OSGI environment because split packages do not work well there.

To resolve the problem:
* Move all generated Java classes to the module `components-health-typesystem`
* Copy the XML descriptors to the module `components-health-typesystem` to the package `de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health`
* Retain stub XML descriptors in the places where they currently are (for backwards compatibility when the JARs are used in plain Java) but change them to import the real descriptors from the `components-health-typesystem` module
* Add a dependency to `components-health-typesystem` in all the other modules so they can import the the real descriptors now

issue.title: Add support for multiple server credentials in Maven

labels.name: feature request
labels.description: New feature or request to improve the current logic

issue.body:
**Description:**
Currently, it is possible to generate a `settings.xml` that contains exactly one server section with GH credentials.
Instead, it should be possible to generate multiple server sections with GH credentials.

**Justification:**
When a project depends on multiple other projects that each use GitHub packages, then it needs to include a `repository` declaration for each of these. However, these repository declarations cannot all use the same ID `github` because the IDs must be unique. So in order to be able to draw in dependencies from multiple GitHub packages repositories, it must be possible to generate multiple server sections, one for each of the GitHub packages repositories.

issue.title: bnd-testing-maven-plugin hangs indefinitely when tests are disabled
issue.body:
I wanted to run only a specific test in a particular reactor module using `mvn -Dtest=MyTest -pl :module-to-test -am`.

`test-utils` is a dependency of `module-to-test` and uses `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` as well but has no test called `MyTest`.

When I run the build, `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` hangs indefinitely in `test-utils` waiting for tests to complete (note there are no matching tests in this module).

I expect the  `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` to simply do nothing if there are no matching tests and let the build proceed with the next module in the reactor.

comment.body:
That may be, but it is inconvenient :) IMHO, for a seamless integration, the bnd testing plugin should respect the same configurations as the standard surefire plugin.

In my scenario, I run tests once with surefire and then again once with the bnd testing plugin to ensure that they work properly outside and inside OSGI. That helps among other things discovering OSGI-specific issues which do not appear outside OSGI. 

I don't find documentation for the "test" configuration parameter. Does it support specifying multiple tests? If so, what is the separator? Which property can I specify on the command line to set the parameter? If it is `test`, then it conflicts with surefire if the two are not compatible.

issue.title: bnd-testing-maven-plugin hangs indefinitely when tests are disabled
issue.body:
I wanted to run only a specific test in a particular reactor module using `mvn -Dtest=MyTest -pl :module-to-test -am`.

`test-utils` is a dependency of `module-to-test` and uses `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` as well but has no test called `MyTest`.

When I run the build, `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` hangs indefinitely in `test-utils` waiting for tests to complete (note there are no matching tests in this module).

I expect the  `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` to simply do nothing if there are no matching tests and let the build proceed with the next module in the reactor.

comment.body:
No, the fully qualified name is not `MyTest`. But surefire does not require a FQN. See the example from the [surefire documentation](https://maven.apache.org/surefire/maven-surefire-plugin/test-mojo.html#test):

```
"-Dtest=???Test, !Unstable*, pkg/**/Ci*leTest.java, *Test#test*One+testTwo?????, #fast*+slowTest"
```

issue.title: UIMA components log and then re-throw exceptions which usually leads to errors being logged twice
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
UIMA components log and then re-throw exceptions which usually leads to errors being logged twice:
* first time by the UIMA component wrapper
* then by the code that runs the component/pipeline

In particular in unit tests that intentionally trigger exceptions this is highly annoying as these exceptions logged on the error level are spamming the output and distract developers from other relevant exceptions.

**To Reproduce**
* Build a component that throws an exception e.g. in the `process` method
* Run that and catch exceptions and log them.

**Expected behavior**
At least this should be optional behavior used for cases where the runner code does not handle exceptions. However, to be honest, I believe if the runner code does not log exceptions produced by the components, then that is a problem in the runner code and not a thing the components should be concerned with.

**Please complete the following information:**
 - Version: 3.3.1

Tagset export dropdown disappears when selecting format.

**To Reproduce**

1. Go to the tagset panel
2. Open the export dropdown
3. Select a format
4. Dropdown closes without export

**Expected behavior**
Either the dropdown should remain open or the radio-list used as a format choice should simply be replaced by two buttons exporting either of the supported formats.

**Please complete the following information:**
 - Version and build ID: 25.1

issue.title: DocumentMetaData not included when exporting features
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Hi there,

as described [#3605](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/issues/3605), we are trying to export the INCEpTION TypeSystem such that it allows UIMA subtypes, which would allow us to postprocess the data more easily. This is currently not possible, but we tried a workaround.

### To Reproduce

We did the following:
1. Created a new project
2. Went to "Layers"
	a) Selected one layer
	b) Export -> UIMA (all layers) -> Export
	c) We get this [TypeSystem](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/files/10154008/typesystem.txt), as you can see, there is no "DocumentMetadata". I had to convert it to .txt because GitHub would not allow me to upload it.
3. We used this TypeSystem to build our own TypeSystem. We did not delete anything from it, we just added new types inheriting from NamedEntity, hoping that we could then use this newly created TypeSystem for postprocessing. Code below.

```python
import cassis
from pathlib import Path

p = Path("bugreport")
NE = "de.tudarmstadt.ukp.dkpro.core.api.ner.type.NamedEntity"
typesystem = cassis.load_typesystem(p / "typesystem.xml")
ner_type = typesystem.get_type(NE)
t = typesystem.create_type(
    name="A", supertypeName=ner_type.name
)
typesystem.create_feature(
    domainType=t, name="b", rangeType=cassis.typesystem.TYPE_NAME_STRING
)
typesystem.to_xml(p / "ModTypeSystem.xml")
```
4. We imported this TypeSystem in INCEpTION, which resulted "A" to appear in the list of layers, with "b" as feature.
5. We imported at random document into INCEpTION and did some random annotations
6. Now, we exported the document (as CAS XML 1.0), which exports both the document in CAS format ([text.txt](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/files/10154055/text.txt) had to convert it to txt to upload it) and the [TypeSystem.txt](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/files/10154057/TypeSystem.txt). Now, the TypeSystem has the DocumentMetadata type, which is not present in the original TypeSystem. 
```python
downloaded_location = p / "text"
ts = cassis.load_typesystem(downloaded_location / "TypeSystem.xml")
c = cassis.load_cas_from_xmi(downloaded_location / "text.xmi", ts)
print("Works for newly created typesystem, but does not have subtypes")
print(c, c.select(NE))

ts_old = cassis.load_typesystem(Path("ModTypeSystem.xml"))
print("Does not work for the original modified typesystem, which has subtypes")
c = cassis.load_cas_from_xmi(downloaded_location / "text.xmi", ts_old)
```
Output
```
Works for newly created typesystem, but does not have subtypes
<cassis.cas.Cas object at 0x10c46cdf0> []
Does not work for the original modified typesystem, which has subtypes
Traceback (most recent call last):
...
cassis.typesystem.TypeNotFoundError: Type with name [de.tudarmstadt.ukp.dkpro.core.api.metadata.type.DocumentMetaData] not found!
```

The idea was to use the TypeSystem that we created for the postprocessing, but since it seems like some elements are added to the TypeSystem at export time, this is currently not possible. 

### Expected behavior

The first exported TypeSystem should have all the needed types.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Environment

Version and build ID: 26.1 (2022-11-29 18:43:46, build eb26b57e)
Operating system: OSX
Browser: Chrome


### Additional context

I have not tried yet, but I believe that modifying the TypeSystem _after_ downloading would probably fix it, which would make our workflow a bit less nice, but it's still possible. I am not sure if this is a bug, or if this is actually the expected behaviour, so thank you in advance anyways for your time!

Best,

Giulia & @karzideh

comment.body:
When exporting the UIMA type system, INCEpTION only exports the types related to the layers defined in the project. If we did not do that, the type system would be spammed by tons of DKPro Core types (such as the one you are missing) and the type system file would be considerably larger. INCEpTION does not use most of the DKPro Core types though.

We could introduce a second export option to export a full UIMA type system that includes all types INCEpTION knows about - even the ones that it does't use.

comment.body:
Where did you get the type system from step 6 from (i.e. the one that contains the DKPro Core `DocumentMetaData` type?

Well, if you have an XMI file that contains a DKPro Core `DocumentMetaData` annotation, then you'd have to copy that type definition over to the modified type system. You could to this manually or programmatically. Cf. e.g. https://cassis.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/cassis/typesystem.html#merge_typesystems

import cassis
from pathlib import Path

p = Path("bugreport")
NE = "de.tudarmstadt.ukp.dkpro.core.api.ner.type.NamedEntity"
typesystem = cassis.load_typesystem(p / "typesystem.xml")
ner_type = typesystem.get_type(NE)
t = typesystem.create_type(
    name="A", supertypeName=ner_type.name
)
typesystem.create_feature(
    domainType=t, name="b", rangeType=cassis.typesystem.TYPE_NAME_STRING
)
typesystem.to_xml(p / "ModTypeSystem.xml")
```
4. We imported this TypeSystem in INCEpTION, which resulted "A" to appear in the list of layers, with "b" as feature.
5. We imported at random document into INCEpTION and did some random annotations
6. Now, we exported the document (as CAS XML 1.0), which exports both the document in CAS format ([text.txt](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/files/10154055/text.txt) had to convert it to txt to upload it) and the [TypeSystem.txt](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/files/10154057/TypeSystem.txt). Now, the TypeSystem has the DocumentMetadata type, which is not present in the original TypeSystem. 
```python
downloaded_location = p / "text"
ts = cassis.load_typesystem(downloaded_location / "TypeSystem.xml")
c = cassis.load_cas_from_xmi(downloaded_location / "text.xmi", ts)
print("Works for newly created typesystem, but does not have subtypes")
print(c, c.select(NE))

ts_old = cassis.load_typesystem(Path("ModTypeSystem.xml"))
print("Does not work for the original modified typesystem, which has subtypes")
c = cassis.load_cas_from_xmi(downloaded_location / "text.xmi", ts_old)
```
Output
```
Works for newly created typesystem, but does not have subtypes
<cassis.cas.Cas object at 0x10c46cdf0> []
Does not work for the original modified typesystem, which has subtypes
Traceback (most recent call last):
...
cassis.typesystem.TypeNotFoundError: Type with name [de.tudarmstadt.ukp.dkpro.core.api.metadata.type.DocumentMetaData] not found!
```

The idea was to use the TypeSystem that we created for the postprocessing, but since it seems like some elements are added to the TypeSystem at export time, this is currently not possible. 

### Expected behavior

The first exported TypeSystem should have all the needed types.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Environment

Version and build ID: 26.1 (2022-11-29 18:43:46, build eb26b57e)
Operating system: OSX
Browser: Chrome


### Additional context

I have not tried yet, but I believe that modifying the TypeSystem _after_ downloading would probably fix it, which would make our workflow a bit less nice, but it's still possible. I am not sure if this is a bug, or if this is actually the expected behaviour, so thank you in advance anyways for your time!

Best,

Giulia & @karzideh

comment.body:
Ok, so here is what I did:

* Create a new project
* Go to the layer panel in the project settings
* Press the "create" button to create a new layer
* Set the name of the layer to "Document metadata"
* Choose the type "Document metadata"
* Save the layer
* Export the UIMA type system
* Open the exported XML file in a text editor and search for `webanno.custom.Documentmetadata`
```
        <typeDescription>
            <name>webanno.custom.Documentmetadata</name>
            <description/>
            <supertypeName>uima.cas.AnnotationBase</supertypeName>
        </typeDescription>
```

In your description of the process, I don't see that you actually created a document metadata layer. Did you create one?

issue.title: Resolve split packages
issue.body:
Currently, all type system modules use the same package name. This creates problems in OSGI environment because split packages do not work well there.

To resolve the problem:
* Move all generated Java classes to the module `components-health-typesystem`
* Copy the XML descriptors to the module `components-health-typesystem` to the package `de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health`
* Retain stub XML descriptors in the places where they currently are (for backwards compatibility when the JARs are used in plain Java) but change them to import the real descriptors from the `components-health-typesystem` module
* Add a dependency to `components-health-typesystem` in all the other modules so they can import the the real descriptors now

issue.title: Add support for multiple server credentials in Maven

labels.name: feature request
labels.description: New feature or request to improve the current logic

issue.body:
**Description:**
Currently, it is possible to generate a `settings.xml` that contains exactly one server section with GH credentials.
Instead, it should be possible to generate multiple server sections with GH credentials.

**Justification:**
When a project depends on multiple other projects that each use GitHub packages, then it needs to include a `repository` declaration for each of these. However, these repository declarations cannot all use the same ID `github` because the IDs must be unique. So in order to be able to draw in dependencies from multiple GitHub packages repositories, it must be possible to generate multiple server sections, one for each of the GitHub packages repositories.

issue.title: bnd-testing-maven-plugin hangs indefinitely when tests are disabled
issue.body:
I wanted to run only a specific test in a particular reactor module using `mvn -Dtest=MyTest -pl :module-to-test -am`.

`test-utils` is a dependency of `module-to-test` and uses `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` as well but has no test called `MyTest`.

When I run the build, `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` hangs indefinitely in `test-utils` waiting for tests to complete (note there are no matching tests in this module).

I expect the  `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` to simply do nothing if there are no matching tests and let the build proceed with the next module in the reactor.

comment.body:
That may be, but it is inconvenient :) IMHO, for a seamless integration, the bnd testing plugin should respect the same configurations as the standard surefire plugin.

In my scenario, I run tests once with surefire and then again once with the bnd testing plugin to ensure that they work properly outside and inside OSGI. That helps among other things discovering OSGI-specific issues which do not appear outside OSGI. 

I don't find documentation for the "test" configuration parameter. Does it support specifying multiple tests? If so, what is the separator? Which property can I specify on the command line to set the parameter? If it is `test`, then it conflicts with surefire if the two are not compatible.

issue.title: bnd-testing-maven-plugin hangs indefinitely when tests are disabled
issue.body:
I wanted to run only a specific test in a particular reactor module using `mvn -Dtest=MyTest -pl :module-to-test -am`.

`test-utils` is a dependency of `module-to-test` and uses `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` as well but has no test called `MyTest`.

When I run the build, `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` hangs indefinitely in `test-utils` waiting for tests to complete (note there are no matching tests in this module).

I expect the  `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` to simply do nothing if there are no matching tests and let the build proceed with the next module in the reactor.

comment.body:
No, the fully qualified name is not `MyTest`. But surefire does not require a FQN. See the example from the [surefire documentation](https://maven.apache.org/surefire/maven-surefire-plugin/test-mojo.html#test):

```
"-Dtest=???Test, !Unstable*, pkg/**/Ci*leTest.java, *Test#test*One+testTwo?????, #fast*+slowTest"
```

issue.title: UIMA components log and then re-throw exceptions which usually leads to errors being logged twice
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
UIMA components log and then re-throw exceptions which usually leads to errors being logged twice:
* first time by the UIMA component wrapper
* then by the code that runs the component/pipeline

In particular in unit tests that intentionally trigger exceptions this is highly annoying as these exceptions logged on the error level are spamming the output and distract developers from other relevant exceptions.

**To Reproduce**
* Build a component that throws an exception e.g. in the `process` method
* Run that and catch exceptions and log them.

**Expected behavior**
At least this should be optional behavior used for cases where the runner code does not handle exceptions. However, to be honest, I believe if the runner code does not log exceptions produced by the components, then that is a problem in the runner code and not a thing the components should be concerned with.

**Please complete the following information:**
 - Version: 3.3.1

issue.title: Tagset export dropdown disappears when selecting format
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Tagset export dropdown disappears when selecting format.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the tagset panel
2. Open the export dropdown
3. Select a format
4. Dropdown closes without export

**Expected behavior**
Either the dropdown should remain open or the radio-list used as a format choice should simply be replaced by two buttons exporting either of the supported formats.

**Please complete the following information:**
 - Version and build ID: 25.1

issue.title: DocumentMetaData not included when exporting features
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Hi there,

as described [#3605](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/issues/3605), we are trying to export the INCEpTION TypeSystem such that it allows UIMA subtypes, which would allow us to postprocess the data more easily. This is currently not possible, but we tried a workaround.

### To Reproduce

We did the following:
1. Created a new project
2. Went to "Layers"
	a) Selected one layer
	b) Export -> UIMA (all layers) -> Export
	c) We get this [TypeSystem](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/files/10154008/typesystem.txt), as you can see, there is no "DocumentMetadata". I had to convert it to .txt because GitHub would not allow me to upload it.
3. We used this TypeSystem to build our own TypeSystem. We did not delete anything from it, we just added new types inheriting from NamedEntity, hoping that we could then use this newly created TypeSystem for postprocessing. Code below.

```python
import cassis
from pathlib import Path

p = Path("bugreport")
NE = "de.tudarmstadt.ukp.dkpro.core.api.ner.type.NamedEntity"
typesystem = cassis.load_typesystem(p / "typesystem.xml")
ner_type = typesystem.get_type(NE)
t = typesystem.create_type(
    name="A", supertypeName=ner_type.name
)
typesystem.create_feature(
    domainType=t, name="b", rangeType=cassis.typesystem.TYPE_NAME_STRING
)
typesystem.to_xml(p / "ModTypeSystem.xml")
```
4. We imported this TypeSystem in INCEpTION, which resulted "A" to appear in the list of layers, with "b" as feature.
5. We imported at random document into INCEpTION and did some random annotations
6. Now, we exported the document (as CAS XML 1.0), which exports both the document in CAS format ([text.txt](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/files/10154055/text.txt) had to convert it to txt to upload it) and the [TypeSystem.txt](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/files/10154057/TypeSystem.txt). Now, the TypeSystem has the DocumentMetadata type, which is not present in the original TypeSystem. 
```python
downloaded_location = p / "text"
ts = cassis.load_typesystem(downloaded_location / "TypeSystem.xml")
c = cassis.load_cas_from_xmi(downloaded_location / "text.xmi", ts)
print("Works for newly created typesystem, but does not have subtypes")
print(c, c.select(NE))

ts_old = cassis.load_typesystem(Path("ModTypeSystem.xml"))
print("Does not work for the original modified typesystem, which has subtypes")
c = cassis.load_cas_from_xmi(downloaded_location / "text.xmi", ts_old)
```
Output
```
Works for newly created typesystem, but does not have subtypes
<cassis.cas.Cas object at 0x10c46cdf0> []
Does not work for the original modified typesystem, which has subtypes
Traceback (most recent call last):
...
cassis.typesystem.TypeNotFoundError: Type with name [de.tudarmstadt.ukp.dkpro.core.api.metadata.type.DocumentMetaData] not found!
```

The idea was to use the TypeSystem that we created for the postprocessing, but since it seems like some elements are added to the TypeSystem at export time, this is currently not possible. 

### Expected behavior

The first exported TypeSystem should have all the needed types.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Environment

Version and build ID: 26.1 (2022-11-29 18:43:46, build eb26b57e)
Operating system: OSX
Browser: Chrome


### Additional context

I have not tried yet, but I believe that modifying the TypeSystem _after_ downloading would probably fix it, which would make our workflow a bit less nice, but it's still possible. I am not sure if this is a bug, or if this is actually the expected behaviour, so thank you in advance anyways for your time!

Best,

Giulia & @karzideh

comment.body:
When exporting the UIMA type system, INCEpTION only exports the types related to the layers defined in the project. If we did not do that, the type system would be spammed by tons of DKPro Core types (such as the one you are missing) and the type system file would be considerably larger. INCEpTION does not use most of the DKPro Core types though.

We could introduce a second export option to export a full UIMA type system that includes all types INCEpTION knows about - even the ones that it does't use.

Where did you get the type system from step 6 from (i.e. the one that contains the DKPro Core `DocumentMetaData` type?

### Describe the bug

Hi there,

as described [#3605](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/issues/3605), we are trying to export the INCEpTION TypeSystem such that it allows UIMA subtypes, which would allow us to postprocess the data more easily. This is currently not possible, but we tried a workaround.

### To Reproduce

We did the following:
1. Created a new project
2. Went to "Layers"
	a) Selected one layer
	b) Export -> UIMA (all layers) -> Export
	c) We get this [TypeSystem](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/files/10154008/typesystem.txt), as you can see, there is no "DocumentMetadata". I had to convert it to .txt because GitHub would not allow me to upload it.
3. We used this TypeSystem to build our own TypeSystem. We did not delete anything from it, we just added new types inheriting from NamedEntity, hoping that we could then use this newly created TypeSystem for postprocessing. Code below.

```python
import cassis
from pathlib import Path

p = Path("bugreport")
NE = "de.tudarmstadt.ukp.dkpro.core.api.ner.type.NamedEntity"
typesystem = cassis.load_typesystem(p / "typesystem.xml")
ner_type = typesystem.get_type(NE)
t = typesystem.create_type(
    name="A", supertypeName=ner_type.name
)
typesystem.create_feature(
    domainType=t, name="b", rangeType=cassis.typesystem.TYPE_NAME_STRING
)
typesystem.to_xml(p / "ModTypeSystem.xml")
```
4. We imported this TypeSystem in INCEpTION, which resulted "A" to appear in the list of layers, with "b" as feature.
5. We imported at random document into INCEpTION and did some random annotations
6. Now, we exported the document (as CAS XML 1.0), which exports both the document in CAS format ([text.txt](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/files/10154055/text.txt) had to convert it to txt to upload it) and the [TypeSystem.txt](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/files/10154057/TypeSystem.txt). Now, the TypeSystem has the DocumentMetadata type, which is not present in the original TypeSystem. 
```python
downloaded_location = p / "text"
ts = cassis.load_typesystem(downloaded_location / "TypeSystem.xml")
c = cassis.load_cas_from_xmi(downloaded_location / "text.xmi", ts)
print("Works for newly created typesystem, but does not have subtypes")
print(c, c.select(NE))

ts_old = cassis.load_typesystem(Path("ModTypeSystem.xml"))
print("Does not work for the original modified typesystem, which has subtypes")
c = cassis.load_cas_from_xmi(downloaded_location / "text.xmi", ts_old)
```
Output
```
Works for newly created typesystem, but does not have subtypes
<cassis.cas.Cas object at 0x10c46cdf0> []
Does not work for the original modified typesystem, which has subtypes
Traceback (most recent call last):
...
cassis.typesystem.TypeNotFoundError: Type with name [de.tudarmstadt.ukp.dkpro.core.api.metadata.type.DocumentMetaData] not found!
```

The idea was to use the TypeSystem that we created for the postprocessing, but since it seems like some elements are added to the TypeSystem at export time, this is currently not possible. 

### Expected behavior

The first exported TypeSystem should have all the needed types.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Environment

Version and build ID: 26.1 (2022-11-29 18:43:46, build eb26b57e)
Operating system: OSX
Browser: Chrome


### Additional context

I have not tried yet, but I believe that modifying the TypeSystem _after_ downloading would probably fix it, which would make our workflow a bit less nice, but it's still possible. I am not sure if this is a bug, or if this is actually the expected behaviour, so thank you in advance anyways for your time!

Best,

Giulia & @karzideh

Ok, so here is what I did:

* Create a new project
* Go to the layer panel in the project settings
* Press the "create" button to create a new layer
* Set the name of the layer to "Document metadata"
* Choose the type "Document metadata"
* Save the layer
* Export the UIMA type system
* Open the exported XML file in a text editor and search for `webanno.custom.Documentmetadata`
```
        <typeDescription>
            <name>webanno.custom.Documentmetadata</name>
            <description/>
            <supertypeName>uima.cas.AnnotationBase</supertypeName>
        </typeDescription>
```

In your description of the process, I don't see that you actually created a document metadata layer. Did you create one?

issue.title: Resolve split packages
issue.body:
Currently, all type system modules use the same package name. This creates problems in OSGI environment because split packages do not work well there.

To resolve the problem:
* Move all generated Java classes to the module `components-health-typesystem`
* Copy the XML descriptors to the module `components-health-typesystem` to the package `de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health`
* Retain stub XML descriptors in the places where they currently are (for backwards compatibility when the JARs are used in plain Java) but change them to import the real descriptors from the `components-health-typesystem` module
* Add a dependency to `components-health-typesystem` in all the other modules so they can import the the real descriptors now

issue.title: Add support for multiple server credentials in Maven

labels.name: feature request
labels.description: New feature or request to improve the current logic

issue.body:
**Description:**
Currently, it is possible to generate a `settings.xml` that contains exactly one server section with GH credentials.
Instead, it should be possible to generate multiple server sections with GH credentials.

**Justification:**
When a project depends on multiple other projects that each use GitHub packages, then it needs to include a `repository` declaration for each of these. However, these repository declarations cannot all use the same ID `github` because the IDs must be unique. So in order to be able to draw in dependencies from multiple GitHub packages repositories, it must be possible to generate multiple server sections, one for each of the GitHub packages repositories.

issue.title: bnd-testing-maven-plugin hangs indefinitely when tests are disabled
issue.body:
I wanted to run only a specific test in a particular reactor module using `mvn -Dtest=MyTest -pl :module-to-test -am`.

`test-utils` is a dependency of `module-to-test` and uses `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` as well but has no test called `MyTest`.

When I run the build, `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` hangs indefinitely in `test-utils` waiting for tests to complete (note there are no matching tests in this module).

I expect the  `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` to simply do nothing if there are no matching tests and let the build proceed with the next module in the reactor.

comment.body:
That may be, but it is inconvenient :) IMHO, for a seamless integration, the bnd testing plugin should respect the same configurations as the standard surefire plugin.

In my scenario, I run tests once with surefire and then again once with the bnd testing plugin to ensure that they work properly outside and inside OSGI. That helps among other things discovering OSGI-specific issues which do not appear outside OSGI. 

I don't find documentation for the "test" configuration parameter. Does it support specifying multiple tests? If so, what is the separator? Which property can I specify on the command line to set the parameter? If it is `test`, then it conflicts with surefire if the two are not compatible.

issue.title: bnd-testing-maven-plugin hangs indefinitely when tests are disabled
issue.body:
I wanted to run only a specific test in a particular reactor module using `mvn -Dtest=MyTest -pl :module-to-test -am`.

`test-utils` is a dependency of `module-to-test` and uses `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` as well but has no test called `MyTest`.

When I run the build, `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` hangs indefinitely in `test-utils` waiting for tests to complete (note there are no matching tests in this module).

I expect the  `bnd-testing-maven-plugin` to simply do nothing if there are no matching tests and let the build proceed with the next module in the reactor.

comment.body:
No, the fully qualified name is not `MyTest`. But surefire does not require a FQN. See the example from the [surefire documentation](https://maven.apache.org/surefire/maven-surefire-plugin/test-mojo.html#test):

```
"-Dtest=???Test, !Unstable*, pkg/**/Ci*leTest.java, *Test#test*One+testTwo?????, #fast*+slowTest"
```

issue.title: UIMA components log and then re-throw exceptions which usually leads to errors being logged twice
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
UIMA components log and then re-throw exceptions which usually leads to errors being logged twice:
* first time by the UIMA component wrapper
* then by the code that runs the component/pipeline

In particular in unit tests that intentionally trigger exceptions this is highly annoying as these exceptions logged on the error level are spamming the output and distract developers from other relevant exceptions.

**To Reproduce**
* Build a component that throws an exception e.g. in the `process` method
* Run that and catch exceptions and log them.

**Expected behavior**
At least this should be optional behavior used for cases where the runner code does not handle exceptions. However, to be honest, I believe if the runner code does not log exceptions produced by the components, then that is a problem in the runner code and not a thing the components should be concerned with.

**Please complete the following information:**
 - Version: 3.3.1

issue.title: Tagset export dropdown disappears when selecting format
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Tagset export dropdown disappears when selecting format.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the tagset panel
2. Open the export dropdown
3. Select a format
4. Dropdown closes without export

**Expected behavior**
Either the dropdown should remain open or the radio-list used as a format choice should simply be replaced by two buttons exporting either of the supported formats.

**Please complete the following information:**
 - Version and build ID: 25.1

issue.body:
**Describe the refactoring action**
Move more application logic from the UI layer down into utilities and services where it becomes easier to test.

**Expected benefit**
Facilitate unit testing.

issue.title: DocumentMetaData not included when exporting features
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Hi there,

as described [#3605](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/issues/3605), we are trying to export the INCEpTION TypeSystem such that it allows UIMA subtypes, which would allow us to postprocess the data more easily. This is currently not possible, but we tried a workaround.

### To Reproduce

We did the following:
1. Created a new project
2. Went to "Layers"
	a) Selected one layer
	b) Export -> UIMA (all layers) -> Export
	c) We get this [TypeSystem](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/files/10154008/typesystem.txt), as you can see, there is no "DocumentMetadata". I had to convert it to .txt because GitHub would not allow me to upload it.
3. We used this TypeSystem to build our own TypeSystem. We did not delete anything from it, we just added new types inheriting from NamedEntity, hoping that we could then use this newly created TypeSystem for postprocessing. Code below.

```python
import cassis
from pathlib import Path

p = Path("bugreport")
NE = "de.tudarmstadt.ukp.dkpro.core.api.ner.type.NamedEntity"
typesystem = cassis.load_typesystem(p / "typesystem.xml")
ner_type = typesystem.get_type(NE)
t = typesystem.create_type(
    name="A", supertypeName=ner_type.name
)
typesystem.create_feature(
    domainType=t, name="b", rangeType=cassis.typesystem.TYPE_NAME_STRING
)
typesystem.to_xml(p / "ModTypeSystem.xml")
```
4. We imported this TypeSystem in INCEpTION, which resulted "A" to appear in the list of layers, with "b" as feature.
5. We imported at random document into INCEpTION and did some random annotations
6. Now, we exported the document (as CAS XML 1.0), which exports both the document in CAS format ([text.txt](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/files/10154055/text.txt) had to convert it to txt to upload it) and the [TypeSystem.txt](https://github.com/inception-project/inception/files/10154057/TypeSystem.txt). Now, the TypeSystem has the DocumentMetadata type, which is not present in the original TypeSystem. 
```python
downloaded_location = p / "text"
ts = cassis.load_typesystem(downloaded_location / "TypeSystem.xml")
c = cassis.load_cas_from_xmi(downloaded_location / "text.xmi", ts)
print("Works for newly created typesystem, but does not have subtypes")
print(c, c.select(NE))

ts_old = cassis.load_typesystem(Path("ModTypeSystem.xml"))
print("Does not work for the original modified typesystem, which has subtypes")
c = cassis.load_cas_from_xmi(downloaded_location / "text.xmi", ts_old)
```
Output
```
Works for newly created typesystem, but does not have subtypes
<cassis.cas.Cas object at 0x10c46cdf0> []
Does not work for the original modified typesystem, which has subtypes
Traceback (most recent call last):
...
cassis.typesystem.TypeNotFoundError: Type with name [de.tudarmstadt.ukp.dkpro.core.api.metadata.type.DocumentMetaData] not found!
```

The idea was to use the TypeSystem that we created for the postprocessing, but since it seems like some elements are added to the TypeSystem at export time, this is currently not possible. 

### Expected behavior

The first exported TypeSystem should have all the needed types.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Environment

Version and build ID: 26.1 (2022-11-29 18:43:46, build eb26b57e)
Operating system: OSX
Browser: Chrome


### Additional context

I have not tried yet, but I believe that modifying the TypeSystem _after_ downloading would probably fix it, which would make our workflow a bit less nice, but it's still possible. I am not sure if this is a bug, or if this is actually the expected behaviour, so thank you in advance anyways for your time!

Best,

Giulia & @karzideh

comment.body:
When exporting the UIMA type system, INCEpTION only exports the types related to the layers defined in the project. If we did not do that, the type system would be spammed by tons of DKPro Core types (such as the one you are missing) and the type system file would be considerably larger. INCEpTION does not use most of the DKPro Core types though.

We could introduce a second export option to export a full UIMA type system that includes all types INCEpTION knows about - even the ones that it does't use.

comment.body:
Where did you get the type system from step 6 from (i.e. the one that contains the DKPro Core `DocumentMetaData` type?

Well, if you have an XMI file that contains a DKPro Core `DocumentMetaData` annotation, then you'd have to copy that type definition over to the modified type system. You could to this manually or programmatically. Cf. e.g. https://cassis.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/cassis/typesystem.html#merge_typesystems

comment.body:
Ok, so here is what I did:

* Create a new project
* Go to the layer panel in the project settings
* Press the "create" button to create a new layer
* Set the name of the layer to "Document metadata"
* Choose the type "Document metadata"
* Save the layer
* Export the UIMA type system
* Open the exported XML file in a text editor and search for `webanno.custom.Documentmetadata`
```
        <typeDescription>
            <name>webanno.custom.Documentmetadata</name>
            <description/>
            <supertypeName>uima.cas.AnnotationBase</supertypeName>
        </typeDescription>
```

In your description of the process, I don't see that you actually created a document metadata layer. Did you create one?
